Articles.Content:
Apologies if this is a dumb question but I'm just starting out with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.

I have a small ship (Mk 1-3 Command Pod + Hitchhiker) crewed by Jeb and Bill. They carried some spare parts to my first space station, and took on some supplies (several of the small 100 NOMS packs stored in the inventory in both the Pod and Hitchhiker) brought up by a second vessel. 

Jeb and Bill then undocked and the life support screen said that they were starving - counting down with 14 days to go. Why can't they access the supply packs?

Likewise, the life support screen for the station only seems to recognise the 300 supplies in the cupola command pod but not the 1000 or so supplies scattered around the station in inventory. 

Have I made some basic design mistake here?

Wild guess but it sounds like you put some of those paks in the inventory slots. That's not how they are used. They are regular part items (like decouplers or heat shields) that you need to attach to your ship and fill with supplies.

> 
> 
> 36 minutes ago, Grimmas said:
> 
> 
> Wild guess but it sounds like you put some of those paks in the inventory slots. That's not how they are used. They are regular part items (like decouplers or heat shields) that you need to attach to your ship and fill with supplies.
> 

So I'd need to bring up umpteen bracket things and fit them with <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>? Oh joy! 

It does seem a bit counter-intuitive that a Kerbal can be sitting next to a container of supplies inside his ship and starve - but when the container is bolted onto the outside of his ship he can eat them...

Well, no. Even if you bolt them on using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> or the stock EVA constructions system you still won't get any supplies - just the empty containers, that you will then need to fill with supplies. 

To put it another way, what you brought with you are not supplies but empty cartons. They won't magically turn into supplies. even if you inflate them.

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Grimmas said:
> 
> 
> Well, no. Even if you bolt them on using <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)"><abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr></abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)"><abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr></abbr> or the stock EVA constructions system you still won't get any supplies - just the empty containers, that you will then need to fill with supplies. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> To put it another way, what you brought with you are not supplies but empty cartons. They won't magically turn into supplies. even if you inflate them.
> 

Even better! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") Thanks for the explanation.

I wasn't having a good evening last night as, once Jeb and Bill rendezvoused with the broken satellite, the spare parts showing in the "normal" inventory weren't appearing in the "<abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventory"  so I couldn't see any way to repair the satellite. For a mission intended to complete multiple contracts to fund an upgrade of the R&D it's turned into an expensive failure....At least I got to practice rendezvous and docking...

And you also learned the hard way that the stock inventory and <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventory are mutually incompatible. In fact, unless you are using some other mod that depends on <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr>, it is not a bad idea to get rid of <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> when playing KSP1 .12+

Is there plans to allow the making of Glykerol in lifesupport for the  freezer pods?   Currently, the only way to get it is to add it in the build area.

In some playthrough testing, once I am out in the black, unless I stored extra Glykerol, I am out of freeze juice with no way to make more.

I have been playing around with cfgs and can have it working in Wolf, and using MKS items - (checking for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS of course) - can add a PRR to Github ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 36 minutes ago, RookFett said:
> 
> 
> Is there plans to allow the making of Glykerol in lifesupport for the  freezer pods?   Currently, the only way to get it is to add it in the build area.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> In some playthrough testing, once I am out in the black, unless I stored extra Glykerol, I am out of freeze juice with no way to make more.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I have been playing around with cfgs and can have it working in Wolf, and using MKS items - (checking for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS of course) - can add a PRR to Github ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Hello,

I create a my own solution for this problem with this patch:

Copy the content of, this zip to **gamedata** directory:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/33ku5gqmutdzkt8/pmborg-multi-<abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization"><abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr></abbr>.zip?dl=](https://www.dropbox.com/s/33ku5gqmutdzkt8/pmborg-multi-ISRU.zip?dl=0)1

Then let me know if you like it!

![laOv53H.png](https://i.imgur.com/laOv53H.png)

Looks good - but I was leaning more into using raw materials => Chemicals => Glykerol.

Trying to keep it in the Wolf Realm of resources.

But your example has given me some ideas  - thanks!

stupid me

I saw a mention of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS having a "Deepfreeze" type of mechanic now.  Is this true?  I do not seem to see any part like this in my parts list.  Granted I have not done extensive testing and research into this yet, as I am not even sure if it is true.  I did not see it on an official posting by [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) it was posted elsewhere.  If this is the case however that would be nice to be able to remove that mod from my install and simplify things a bit more.  

Can anybody point me to an official post, or users guide, that talks about this if it is indeed part of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS?

> 
> 
> 19 minutes ago, Bit Fiddler said:
> 
> 
> I saw a mention of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS having a "Deepfreeze" type of mechanic now.  Is this true?  I do not seem to see any part like this in my parts list.  Granted I have not done extensive testing and research into this yet, as I am not even sure if it is true.  I did not see it on an official posting by [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) it was posted elsewhere.  If this is the case however that would be nice to be able to remove that mod from my install and simplify things a bit more.  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Can anybody point me to an official post, or users guide, that talks about this if it is indeed part of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS?
> 

Yep - it's in the bleeding edge version - which is very stable despite the name ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

[https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS/releases](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/releases)

Ah cool, I just install from <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> so I had not seen this version.  Just in time as well, as I have started a new career game, and have not used any deepfreeze parts yet, so nothing will break by removing it.
What would a command pod patch need to be compatable with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS?

> 
> 
> Just now, AtomicTech said:
> 
> 
> What would a command pod patch need to be compatable with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS?
> 

Command pods are automatically compatible.  If you want anything other than the basic crew space bonus that all parts with ModuleCommand get, you can look at the other stock patches included with the mod.

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> Command pods are automatically compatible.  If you want anything other than the basic crew space bonus that all parts with ModuleCommand get, you can look at the other stock patches included with the mod.
> 

Thanks!

I'm working on a <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS patch for Taerobee right now, so your help is greatly appreciated!

-

realized it was the settings

Hello,  so I tried to read documentation on this mod wherever I could find it but I still have some questions for you all:

1)I tested out some hab parts and my 2-star Jeb had infinite hab but my 2-star Bill had 6 years.   Both 2 star rank, both veteran Kerbals.  Why did Bill have less hab time?

2)When it says the small recycler supports 1 Kerbal,  is that literally one Kerbal or does it spread/average out the effect to all Kerbals aboard?  

3)Do I need to land all my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> vehicles and dock them together or is there a proximity effect with the life support?

**Edited <time datetime="2022-02-10T04:12:14Z" title="02/10/2022 04:12  AM" data-short="2 yr">February 10, 2022</time> by mcbmaestro**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, mcbmaestro said:
> 
> 
> 1)I tested out some hab parts and my 2-star Jeb had infinite hab but my 2-star Bill had 6 years.   Both 2 star rank, both veteran Kerbals.  Why did Bill have less hab time?
> 

Pilots are a little special and get infinite hab earlier than the others (50 years??).  I've forgotten the limit.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, mcbmaestro said:
> 
> 
> 2)When it says the small recycler supports 1 Kerbal,  is that literally one Kerbal or does it spread/average out the effect to all Kerbals aboard?
> 

The quoted recycler reduction applies to the number of Kerbals listed.  After that number, extra Kerbals do not receive the benefit.  Add more or more powerful recyclers.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, mcbmaestro said:
> 
> 
> 3)Do I need to land all my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> vehicles and dock them together or is there a proximity effect with the life support?
> 

You don't need to dock them most of the time, but I'm unsure about this - does life support work on the 'nearby' principle?   Someone else needs to answer this one.
Depends on what you call life support, for supplies you can be nearby and use logistics, for the hab stuff you have to be connected.

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, modus said:
> 
> 
> Depends on what you call life support, for supplies you can be nearby and use logistics, for the hab stuff you have to be connected.
> 

Well I just did a test.  I had a vehicle with supplies drive up to a vehicle with hab parts.   At about 150m distance and lower,  they both received the hab benefit but not the supply benefit.

And you said I need logistics?  What is the logistics aspect exactly?  A logistic module or something?

I found this explaining things but I'm still really struggling with it all.   I just want to make sure my first science lab can get supplies if it runs out.

![9i13qGgkosRSS8C-9bqoc7rIWqPBuBR4IGliiGKk](https://external-preview.redd.it/9i13qGgkosRSS8C-9bqoc7rIWqPBuBR4IGliiGKkkJM.png?auto=webp&s=e873b47cbe2d0dadf1f1b184eb7d90f17bef71e0)

**Edited <time datetime="2022-02-11T00:01:19Z" title="02/11/2022 12:01  AM" data-short="2 yr">February 11, 2022</time> by mcbmaestro**

I have JNSQ installed, which changes kerbin to have a 12 hour day instead of the stock 6 hour day. Will this change anthing about <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS, or will the per-second rate stay the same? Will the timer window be accurate still?

Ok, wait a minute am I entirely missing another mod here?   Do I need the MKS Kolonization mod in order to transfer supplies?   What if I just want to transfer the supplies with just <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support?  Then it has to be done manually?

**Edited <time datetime="2022-02-11T00:24:34Z" title="02/11/2022 12:24  AM" data-short="2 yr">February 11, 2022</time> by mcbmaestro**
I'm not sure actually, never played LS without MKS![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, mcbmaestro said:
> 
> 
> Ok, wait a minute am I entirely missing another mod here?   Do I need the MKS Kolonization mod in order to transfer supplies?   What if I just want to transfer the supplies with just <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> Life Support?  Then it has to be done manually?
> 

Correct.  All the Logistics stuff is in MKS.  If you're using Life Support on its own you will need to transfer the physical life support resources the same way as any resource in a stock game (e.g. ore).  Without MKS, only the "habitation" mechanic shares magically between craft in close proximity.
